analysis.progressMessage:
We're carefully examining {url}.
Please wait a moment! (Takes about 2-3 minutes)
analysis.completionMessage: üí™ Once analysis is complete, we'll provide easy-to-follow improvement suggestions!
analysis.perfectScoreNote: üí° Perfect 100 points isn't necessary! Above 70 points is excellent SEO.
analysis.categoryBreakdown: Out of {total} items: {excellent} excellent, {average} average, {needsWork} need work
analysis.summaryText: Focus on resolving {dangerCount} critical issues and {warningCount} improvements first.
analysis.analysisReliability: Analysis Reliability: This information is obtained from analyzing actual web pages. For more accurate analysis, please refer to Google Analytics or Search Console data.
analysis.additionalResultsNote: The items below are for reference and do not significantly affect the overall score.

currentValues.mobileNotProperDisplay: May not display properly on mobile devices.
currentValues.speedVeryFastDetail: ‚ö° Website loads very fast! Visitors can see it immediately without waiting, which is great.
currentValues.speedAverageDetail: üö∂ Website speed is average. Making it a bit faster will make visitors more satisfied.
currentValues.speedSlowDetail: üêå Website is too slow. Visitors might get tired of waiting and go to other sites. Speed improvement is essential!
currentValues.moreContentNeeded: More content could help with SEO.
currentValues.socialNeedsImprovement: Adding social media sharing settings can help you get more visitors.
currentValues.structuredDataGood: ‚úÖ Google knows exactly what your site is about! Stars, prices, reviews, etc. can appear nicely in search results.
currentValues.structuredDataBad: ‚ùå Google doesn't really know what you sell or what services you provide. If you kindly explain to Google, you'll stand out more in search results!
currentValues.technicalSeoDescription: Technical SEO helps search engines read your site properly.
currentValues.structuredDataExplanation: Schema.org structured data is well set up! This is like kindly explaining to Google 'Our site is a cafe, here's our phone number, here's our address'.
currentValues.structuredDataMissing: No structured data (Schema.org). This is like doing business without a store sign. If you tell Google 'We are a ‚óã‚óã business, our contact is this', you'll show up better in search results!

techSeo.structuredDataGood: ‚úÖ Schema.org markup exists so Google accurately understands your site! Stars, prices, operating hours, etc. can appear nicely in search results.
techSeo.structuredDataBad: ‚ùå No structured data. It's like doing business without a store sign. Tell Google 'We are a ‚óã‚óã business, our contact is this' and you'll show up better in search results!
techSeo.structuredDataTip: What is structured data? Code that kindly explains to Google 'Our site is a cafe, address is here, phone number is this'

linkAnalysis.excellentStructure: ‚úÖ Excellent link structure! Internal links make users explore your site longer, and external links increase credibility.
linkAnalysis.averageStructure: ‚ö†Ô∏è Link structure could be better. Using internal links (2+) and external links (1+) appropriately would be better for SEO.
linkAnalysis.poorStructure: ‚ùå Almost no links. Please add links to related internal pages or trustworthy external sites.
linkAnalysis.internalLinksNeeded: Add more internal links (related pages, categories, previous posts, etc.)
linkAnalysis.externalLinksNeeded: Add links to trustworthy external sites
linkAnalysis.tooManyLinks: Too many links. Keep only important links

keywords.warning: Keyword usage can be improved. Try using important keywords more naturally.

semantic-markup.danger: Semantic markup is lacking. Search engine optimization and accessibility improvements are needed.

questions.question: Is the SEO analysis service free?
questions.answer: Yes, it's completely free! No registration required, just enter a URL and get instant analysis results. We plan to keep it free forever.

questions.question: How long does analysis take?
questions.answer: Usually 2-3 minutes. Depending on your site's size and complexity, it might take a bit longer, but most analyses complete within 3 minutes.

questions.question: Can I analyze any type of website?
questions.answer: We can analyze most websites including personal blogs, company websites, e-commerce sites, and portfolios. However, sites requiring login or with restricted access may be difficult to analyze.

questions.question: What exactly is SEO?
questions.answer: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. Simply put, it's all the activities to make your site rank higher when people search on Google or other search engines.

questions.question: What should I do if my SEO score is low?
questions.answer: Don't worry! Just follow the improvement suggestions we provide one by one. We prioritize the most important items, so follow them step by step. You don't need a perfect 100 score.

questions.question: When will I see SEO results?
questions.answer: SEO takes time. You might see changes in 1-2 weeks at the earliest, but typically it takes 1-3 months to see results in search rankings. Consistent improvement is most important.

questions.question: What if analysis fails or errors occur?
questions.answer: Try these steps: 1) Check if the URL is correct 2) Verify the site is accessible 3) Try again after a moment. If problems persist, let us know through feedback and we'll fix it quickly.

questions.question: Can I use it on mobile devices?
questions.answer: Yes! It works perfectly on mobile devices. You can use it conveniently on smartphones or tablets.

questions.question: How should I interpret the analysis results?
questions.answer: The analysis results are designed to be easily understood by beginners. Red indicates areas that need improvement, yellow means average, and green means good condition. Each item comes with specific improvement methods.

questions.question: Can I compare with competitors?
questions.answer: Currently, we only provide single-site analysis. However, we're developing a feature to compare with industry average scores. We're continuously improving for better service.

questions.question: How should I modify titles and descriptions?
questions.answer: Keep titles within 30 characters and descriptions within 150 characters. Naturally include content users would be curious about and main keywords. The analysis results provide detailed current status and improvement plans.

questions.question: How do I optimize images?
questions.answer: Change image file names to meaningful names and add ALT text (alternative text). Also adjust image sizes to not be too large. Detailed methods are explained in our SEO guide.

questions.question: How can I improve site speed?
questions.answer: Image size optimization, removing unnecessary plugins, and using good hosting services help. If technical aspects are difficult, asking a web developer for help is also a good approach.

questions.question: How do I do SEO for local businesses?
questions.answer: Registering with Naver Place and Google My Business is most important. Also use keywords that include location names and clearly display accurate addresses and phone numbers on your website.

questions.question: Which is more important, Naver or Google?
questions.answer: Naver is still important in Korea, but Google's influence is also growing. It's good to optimize for both search engines. Our service analyzes based on principles that apply to both search engines.

whatIsSeo.title: What is SEO?
whatIsSeo.subtitle: What is SEO?
whatIsSeo.intro: SEO stands for "Search Engine Optimization". Simply put, it's about making your website appear higher in Google search results.
whatIsSeo.exampleContent: If you run a cafe, the goal is to have your cafe appear on the first page of search results when people search for "Gangnam cafe" or "delicious coffee"!

whySeo.title: Why do you need SEO?
whySeo.description: The importance and benefits of SEO
whySeo.subtitle: Why do you need SEO?

moreCustomers.title: More Customers
moreCustomers.description: The higher you rank in search results, the more people visit your website.

freeMarketing.title: Free Marketing
freeMarketing.description: It's the best way to attract customers naturally without advertising costs.

targetedCustomers.title: Targeted Customers
targetedCustomers.description: People who really need your products or services will find you.

pageTitle.title: Page Title (Title Tag)
pageTitle.description: The blue title that appears in search results. It's one of the most important SEO elements.
pageTitle.goodExampleContent: "Gangnam Station Restaurant Cafe | Fresh Coffee Beans and Dessert Specialty"

metaDescription.title: Page Description (Meta Description)
metaDescription.description: The description text that appears below the title in search results. It's an important factor in whether people click.
metaDescription.tip3: Include content users would be curious about

imageOptimization.title: Image Optimization
imageOptimization.description: Images also affect search results. They're especially important for image search.
imageOptimization.checklist1: Describe content in Korean or English in file names

localBusiness.item2: Write titles with location + business type
localBusiness.item3: Accurately enter address and phone number

contentWriting.item1: Focus on what customers are curious about

structuredData.googleUnderstands: Google accurately understands your site information
structuredData.googleDoesntKnow: Google doesn't accurately know what your site is about
structuredData.explanation: Structured data (Schema.org) is special code that kindly explains your site to Google:
examples: üè¢ **Business description:** "We are a cafe", "We are a hospital"
üìç **Location info:** "Address is here", "Phone number is this"
structuredData.effectsDescription: When you apply structured data, search results change like this:
structuredData.normalResultTitle: Delicious Cafe - Fresh Coffee and Desserts
structuredData.normalResultDesc: Enjoy fresh coffee and handmade desserts at Delicious Cafe...
implementationMethods: Verify with Google Structured Data Testing Tool

semanticMarkup.wellStructured: Semantic markup is well structured! Search engines and screen readers can easily understand it.
semanticMarkup.partiallyStructured: Semantic markup is partially structured. A few improvements will make it even better.
semanticMarkup.needsImprovement: Semantic markup is lacking. Improvements are needed for search engine optimization and accessibility enhancement.
semanticMarkup.accessibilityDescription: Accessibility attributes for visually impaired and screen readers:
semanticMarkup.recommendation: Use at least 3 or more ARIA attributes
semanticMarkup.benefitsDescription: Using semantic markup has these great benefits:
benefitsList: Search engine optimization: Google better understands page structure
Improved accessibility: Visually impaired can easily use websites
Various device support: Screen readers, voice browsers, etc.
Easy maintenance: Clear code structure makes management easier
Future-oriented: Modern websites following web standards

robots.wellConfigured: Search engines can systematically crawl the site
robots.needsConfiguration: robots.txt file can manage search engine crawling more efficiently
robots.robotsDescription: robots.txt is a guide that tells search engines "how to navigate this site":
robotsFunctions: Traffic signals: Which pages are allowed and which are not
Map provision: Tells sitemap location to help find all pages easily
Efficiency increase: Allows search engines to focus on important pages
Security enhancement: Blocks access to admin or private pages
exampleMeaningList: All search engines can access the site
Sitemap location is specified so all pages can be found easily
robots.creationSteps: How to create a robots.txt file:
creationStepsList: Write in notepad: Create as a simple text file
Verification method: Enter "siteaddress/robots.txt" in browser to check
WordPress: Easy setup with SEO plugins (Yoast, RankMath)

sitemap.wellConfigured: Search engines can systematically collect all pages of the site
sitemap.needsConfiguration: Adding a sitemap allows search engines to discover more pages
sitemap.sitemapDescription: A sitemap is like a "table of contents" or "building blueprint" for your website:
sitemapFunctions: Page list: A file that organizes addresses of all pages on the site
Update information: When each page was last modified
Importance indication: Shows which pages are more important
Quick discovery: Search engines can quickly find new pages when created
sitemap.benefitsDescription: Having a sitemap provides these great benefits:

benefitsList.title: Increased Search Visibility
benefitsList.description: Google can easily find all pages of your site and expose them more in search results

benefitsList.title: Fast Indexing
benefitsList.description: Search engines quickly collect new posts or pages when uploaded

benefitsList.title: SEO Improvement
benefitsList.description: Basic setting that helps improve search rankings

benefitsList.title: Analytics Available
benefitsList.description: Check which pages are being searched in Google Search Console

creationStepsList: WordPress: Auto-generate with Yoast SEO, RankMath plugins
Shopping malls: Auto-generation features provided by Cafe24, MakeShop, etc.
Manual creation: Use online tools like XML-Sitemaps.com
Google registration: Submit sitemap address to Google Search Console

speed.problems: When sites are slow, these problems occur:
speed.labDataDesc:
Data measured in Google's standard test environment
Accurate and comparable as measured in consistent environment
FCP: Time for first content to appear
LCP: Time for largest content to load
CLS: How stable the page layout is
TBT: Time when page doesn't respond
speed.fieldDataDesc:
Speed data experienced by actual visitors
Average across various devices and network environments
Data provided only when there are enough visitors
More realistic and reliable data
Classified as **Fast/Average/Slow**
speed.fieldDataTip: üí° If Field Data is available, use it based on actual user experience, otherwise use Lab Data for reference!
speed.problemsDescription: When sites are slow, these problems occur:
problemsList: üò§ **Visitor Bounce:** Over 50% leave if it takes more than 3 seconds
üì± **Mobile Inconvenience:** Takes even longer on phones
üîç **Search Ranking Drop:** Google dislikes slow sites
üí∏ **Revenue Loss:** 1% revenue decrease for every 0.1 second delay
improvementMethodsList: üñºÔ∏è **Image Optimization:** Make large images smaller (WebP format recommended)
üåê **Use CDN:** Fast access from anywhere in the world

images.totalImages: A total of {count} images were found
images.seoDescription: Images can also appear in search results! To be found in Google image search:
altTextExplanation: üìù **Alt text:** Text describing what the image is about
üìè **Appropriate size:** Not too big or too small
‚ö° **Fast loading:** Compress to reduce file size

content.wordCountInfo: A total of {count} words of content were analyzed
content.importanceDescription: Good content is the core of SEO:
importanceList: üéØ **Customer satisfaction:** Providing useful information makes visitors stay longer
üîç **Google evaluation:** Google recognizes your site as valuable
üìà **Search ranking:** Better content leads to higher search rankings
creationTips: üìè **Sufficient length:** At least 300 words (more detail is better)
üéØ **Customer-focused:** Focus on what customers want to know
üì± **Easy to read:** Short sentences, appropriate line breaks
üìä **Practical information:** Specific details like prices, location, contact

technical.description: Technical SEO consists of settings that help search engines properly read your site:
explanationList: üì± **Mobile settings:** Making it display properly on phones
üåç **Language setting:** Telling what language your site is in
ü§ñ **Search permission:** Allowing Google to collect pages
technical.improvementDescription: Most of these need to be set by website administrators or developers:
improvementSteps: üîß **Developer request:** Add necessary tags to HTML head section
üìã **Checklist:** Check issues in Google Search Console
‚ö° **Effect:** Immediate search engine recognition improvement once set
technical.developerNote: üí° If technical aspects are difficult, consult web developers or website management companies!

https.protectedMessage: Site is protected with SSL certificate
https.unprotectedMessage: Site is provided over insecure HTTP
https.importanceDescription: HTTPS is the foundation of website security:
implementationSteps: üìã **Purchase SSL certificate:** Buy from hosting provider or SSL authority
‚öôÔ∏è **Server setup:** Install SSL certificate on web server
üîç **Update internal links:** Change all links to HTTPS
üÜì **Free options:** Use Let's Encrypt or CloudFlare

links.totalLinks: A total of {count} links were found
links.importanceDescription: Links are like the road network of your website:
linkTypes: üè† **Internal links:** Connect to other pages within your site
üìà **SEO effect:** Helps Google understand site structure
üë• **User experience:** Helps find related information easily
strategyTips: üìù **Connect related pages:** Link similar topic articles together
üéØ **Clear link text:** Use specific descriptions instead of "click here"
üîç **Trustworthy external links:** Link to authoritative sites
üìä **Appropriate number:** Not too many, not too few
üÜï **Open in new window:** External links should open in new tab

keywords.description: Keyword optimization makes your content easier to find in searches:
principles: üéØ **Target keywords:** Choose words customers are likely to search
üìù **Natural usage:** Use naturally, don't force keywords in
üìç **Key locations:** Include in titles, headings, first paragraph
tipsList: üéØ **Long-tail keywords:** "Delicious cafe near Gangnam Station" rather than just "cafe"
üìä **Check search volume:** Use Naver keyword tools
üèÜ **Competitor analysis:** See what keywords top sites use
üì± **Local keywords:** Include location names for local businesses
üîÑ **Use synonyms:** Use various expressions with the same meaning

title.tooLong: Title is too long ({length} chars). Under 60 characters recommended.

suggestions.addKeywords: Include main keywords at the beginning of the title

suggestions.includeNumbers: Including specific numbers or years adds credibility
suggestions.avoidDuplication: Don't make H1 and title exactly the same

content.name: Content Quality
content.tooShort: Content is too short ({words} words). Minimum 300 words recommended.
content.noHeadings: No heading tags (H1-H6) found. Create structured content.

suggestions.addMoreContent: Add more detailed and useful information
suggestions.useHeadings: Use heading tags to structure content
suggestions.improveReadability: Make it easy to read with short sentences and paragraphs

socialMedia.name: Social Media
socialMedia.description: Information displayed when sharing on social media
socialMedia.missingOg: Open Graph tags are missing. Information won't display properly when shared on social media.

suggestions.addOgTags: Add Open Graph tags to optimize social media sharing
suggestions.testSharing: Test by actually sharing on social media

structuredData.name: Structured Data
structuredData.description: Data format that search engines can easily understand
structuredData.missing: Structured data is missing. Missing rich snippet opportunities.

suggestions.addJsonLd: Add structured data in JSON-LD format
suggestions.addBusiness: Provide business information as structured data
suggestions.testWithTools: Validate with Google's structured data testing tool

technical.name: Technical Elements
technical.description: Basic technical settings of the website
technical.missingViewport: Missing viewport tag for mobile optimization.
technical.missingRobots: Search engine crawling settings are not clear.

suggestions.addViewport: Add viewport meta tag for mobile optimization
suggestions.setRobots: Clarify crawling policy with robots meta tag
suggestions.addCanonical: Add canonical tag specifying the standard URL

https.name: Security (HTTPS)
https.notSecure: Not using HTTPS. This is disadvantageous for security and SEO.

suggestions.enableHttps: Install SSL certificate and enable HTTPS
suggestions.redirectHttp: Set up automatic redirect from HTTP to HTTPS
suggestions.updateLinks: Update all internal links to HTTPS

links.name: Link Structure
links.fewInternal: Insufficient internal links. Strengthen connections within the site.
links.tooManyExternal: Too many external links. Link juice may be dispersed.

suggestions.addInternal: Add internal links to related pages

keywords.name: Keyword Optimization
keywords.lowDensity: Keyword density is low. Naturally include more keywords.
keywords.highDensity: Keyword density is too high. Excessive repetition may result in penalties.

suggestions.research: Research appropriate keywords using keyword tools

semanticMarkup.name: Semantic Markup
semanticMarkup.poorStructure: Heading tag structure is not logical.

suggestions.useSemanticTags: Use semantic tags like header, nav, main, footer
suggestions.logicalHeadings: Use heading tags (H1~H6) in order to create logical structure
suggestions.structureContent: Structure content appropriately according to meaning

robots.name: Robot Crawling
robots.blockingImportant: Important pages are being blocked by robots.txt.
robots.exists: Can control how search engines crawl the site.

suggestions.createRobots: Create robots.txt file to set crawling policy
suggestions.testRobots: Test that robots.txt file works correctly
suggestions.addSitemap: It's good to add sitemap location to robots.txt (e.g., Sitemap: https://example.com/sitemap.xml).

sitemap.name: Sitemap
sitemap.description: Site structure information for search engines
sitemap.missing: Sitemap is missing. Search engines may not be able to discover all pages on the site.
sitemap.exists: Sitemap exists. Search engines can easily find all pages on the site.

suggestions.createSitemap: Create sitemap.xml file and upload it to website root.
suggestions.submitToGoogle: Submit sitemap to Google Search Console
suggestions.keepUpdated: Regularly check that sitemap is up to date.
suggestions.useTools: Sitemap generation tools can be used to create one easily.
suggestions.goodInRobots: Good that sitemap location is specified in robots.txt.
suggestions.addToRobots: Consider adding sitemap location to robots.txt.

mobile.name: Mobile Optimization
mobile.description: Usability and accessibility on mobile devices

suggestions.makeButtonsEasy: Make buttons and links easy to tap with fingers
suggestions.adjustTextSize: Adjust text size to be easily readable on mobile
suggestions.adjustScreenSize: Set screen to adjust to mobile screen size

issues.illogicalHeadings: Heading tag order is not logical

positiveFeedback.mainContent: ‚úÖ Main content area is well defined
positiveFeedback.headerFooter: ‚úÖ Header and footer areas are clearly separated
positiveFeedback.headingStructure: ‚úÖ Heading tag structure is logically well organized
